extendedInfo.description: The iCycleBeads app enables a woman to plan or prevent pregnancy easily and effectively by tracking her periods and identifying her fertile and non-fertile days. It is the only Android app in the world based on the patented Standard Days MethodÂ®, a modern natural family planning method that has been researched extensively in large-scale clinical trials. iCycleBeads is a new way to use this effective, side-effect free, easy to use, and educational family planning method.  The app features the visual tool CycleBeads which has been used by millions of women worldwide to help them track their cycles and use this method correctly either as birth control or to plan a pregnancy.To use iCycleBeads, a user simply confirms that her cycles are in the 26-32 day range required for correct use of this family planning method**. She then inputs the date her most recent period started. The app immediately lets her know what day she is on in her cycle, and whether she is on a fertile day or an infertile day as determined by the Standard Days Method of family planning.  She can then use this information to either plan or avoid a pregnancy.  This information is provided in both a calendar format and in a visual representation of CycleBeads.  Key features include:â¢	Individualized visual representations of a userâs cycle based on the start date of her period in both calendar and CycleBeads formatsâ¢	Customizable alerts notifying a user when she is in her fertile window, when her fertile window is ending, and when she is likely to start her next period â¢	An alert reminding a user to input her period start dateâ¢	An alert notifying the user when she has had a cycle outside the range of 26-32 days longâ¢	A notes feature which allows a woman to track key information that she may want to discuss with her health providerâ¢	Ongoing cycle data history that allows a user to easily see the start dates of her previous cycles as well as her cycle lengthsFor more information on the clinical studies behind this family planning method, see the efficacy report published in âContraceptionâ at: http://irh.org/sites/default/files/Efficacy%20SDM%202002.pdfWe will be updating iCycleBeads regularly. Please send us any feedback or requests for improvements to info@cyclebeads.com.iCycleBeads is protected under patent.Sidenote:iCycleBeads is based on a modern calendar-based family planning method. Many people confuse calendar-based family planning methods in general with the ârhythm methodâ. This is incorrect. The ârhythm methodâ is vaguely understood, not well defined, confusing to use, and largely untested. On the contrary, iCycleBeads is based on a family planning method that is thoroughly researched, clearly defined, easy to use, easy to teach, and highly effective. According to efficacy information provided in the medical guidebook âContraceptive Technologyâ, the Standard Days Method, the method on which CycleBeads is based, is as effective or more effective, than other commonly used non-hormonal user-directed methods (e.g. condoms) and is the most effective natural family planning option available in terms of typical use. Sources: * Arevalo M. et al., Contraception, 2002;65;333-338.** According to data from the World Health Organization and analyzed by researchers at Georgetown University, approximately 80% of cycles are in the 26-32 day range.

reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: I have been using this app for a few months now and I think I works great. love the fact that it had been accurate about my periods cycle thus far.
reviews.author: Michelle Simmons

reviews.title: Excellent system
reviews.comment: This is an excellent system.  Very accurate.  Extremely easy to use.  You can view your cycle either in calendar mode or the beads.  I only use the beads. You can see everything at a glance.  The reminders are great!  Well worth the money.  I just wish you would make this in a windows phone app as I will be changing phones soon.  Please make this available at the windows app market.  Please!!!!!!!
reviews.author: Ann Perry

reviews.title: Not bad.
reviews.comment: Thanks for making it android. But could we have a means of exporting data cross platform? After my iphone went,  I was disappointed to find I could not simply import data I had previously emailed to myself as a report from the iphone app.  Otherwise a useful app. And yes, a widget would be great.
reviews.author: Alison Flavell

reviews.title: Love it.
reviews.comment: Great app. Wish it had a widget though. Would give 5 stars then. Do highly recommend though.
reviews.author: Jamie Wampler

reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: Great way to keep track of your periods
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Excellent!
reviews.comment: I had the physical cycle beads system for about 3 years and I am happy to see the  app. The reminders are helpful and the company is sincere.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Great, easy to use app! I was able to enter my two May periods (5/4 & 5/31) with no problem. I only wish it was easier to view notes-you can\'t read it
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: LIke more than expected.
reviews.comment: This is my new favorite app! It\'s so easy, I just enter my date and don\'t have to worry about forgetting where I am in my cycle. I luv the reminders, which I didn\'t know would be part of it, and also the history. I like the cycle representation better than the calendar. It just takes a quick look and you\'ve got the information. This app has been a pleasant surprise - I like it so much better than I expected I would. It gives a kind of confidence.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: In April I got my period twice once on April 1st and then again on the 29th but it won\'t let me add both. It\'s a 28 day cycle...
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: great when you get used to it
reviews.comment: sometimes it can be confusing because it doesn\'t explain much but great once you get used to it
reviews.author: Taylor O\'Dell
